author: jsgoldman
title: Real Madrid step up interest in Kylian Mbappe amid ÂŁ96 million bid from Premier League club
text:
Mbappe has scored 11 goals in his last nine games for Monaco (Picture: Getty) Real Madrid are intensifying their attempts to make Kylian Mbappe their headline summer signing amid reports in Spain of a ÂŁ96 million bid from an unnamed Premier League club.
Antonio Conte report card: Near-perfect start with Chelsea on course for the double Mbappe has enjoyed a stellar breakthrough season forÂ surprise Champions League quarter finalists AS Monaco, scoring 11 goals in his last nine games for Leanardo Jardim’s Ligue 1 leaders.
The 18-year-old, who last week earned his first call-up to the senior France squad, has drawn comparisons with Arsenal legend Thierry Henry and has been linked with a summer move to the Emirates Stadium.
AS claim Real Madrid believe MbappeÂ Both Manchester United and City, whom Mbappe scored against in both legs of their Champions League last 16 defeat, have also been credited with an interest in the prolific teenager, prompting Real Madrid to intensify their efforts to sign one of the most exciting young talents in world football.
Spanish newspaper AS claim Real Madrid have scouted Mbappe on several occasions this season and believe he bears many of the hallmarks of the club’s former striker Ronaldo.
AS quote a club source as saying: ‘Mbappe is a footballer that at one point could end up being a worldwide star.
More: Football Mourinho reveals the one area that puts his Man Utd side miles behind Chelsea greats 
Arsene Wenger provides major update on Alexis Sanchez ankle injury 
Dier: Man Utd legend played key role in me choosing my shirt number at Spurs 
‘He reminds us a lot of Ronaldo, who at that age dazzled at PSV Eindhoven or Henry when we wanted to bring him to Madrid next to Trezeguet.’
Mbappe is expected to make his debut for Didier Deschamps’ side this week with France scheduled to be in World Cup qualifying action against Luxembourg before a glamour friendly against Spain.
MORE: Arsenal face Paris Saint-Germain competition for Kylian Mbappe transfer
